cz.muni.fi.virtualtoolmanager.pubapi.entities

Class PortRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.muni.fi.virtualtoolmanager.pubapi.entities.PortRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<PortRule>

    public final class PortRule
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<PortRule>
    Class that represents a single port-forwarding rule on a single virtual machine.
    For initializing an object of type this class there is used Builder pattern for easier usability and readibility the client code if this class is used.
    See Also:
    VirtualMachineManager, VirtualMachineManagerImpl

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PortRule.Builder
      Class that represents a key part of so called Builder pattern.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        This method is used for check if the actual port rule is same as another port rule. Comparison is performed according to name of port rule and used host port number.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - represents port rule instance which is going to be compared with this port rule
        Returns:
        true if the objects are same, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method is used to print information about this port rule to string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string in form "[Port rule: name=<prname>, protocol=<protocol>, hostIP=<hostIP>, hostPort=<hostPort>, guestIP=<guestIP>, guestPort=<guestPort>]"

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(PortRule rule)
        Method used to compare two port rules - this with another - in order to sort (order) port rules. For comparison are used name of port rule and host port number.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<PortRule>
        Parameters:
        rule - represents port rule with which is this one compared
        Returns:
        -1 if this port rule is less than another one, 0if this port rule is equal to another one, 1if this port rule is greater than another one
